intro: Calceolaria meyeniana subsp. meyeniana, commonly known as the "Mexican slipper orchid," is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or clay soils and thrives in temperate to subtropical climates. Its flowers are usually violet or purple and are known for their intricate, spurred structure. Calceolaria meyeniana subsp. meyeniana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
